National Sentence Text: For the purpose of compliance with this Code as required in Clause 1.2.1.1.(1) of Division A, the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in Division B shall be the objectives and functional statements identified in Sections 3.10., 4.5., 5.10., 6.4., 7.5., 8.3., 9.38., 10.8. and 11.3. (See Note A-1.1.2.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: For the purpose of compliance with this Code as required in Clause 1.2.1.1.(1) of Division A, the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in Division B shall be the objectives and functional statements identified in Sections 3.10., 4.5., 5.10., 6.4., 7.5., 8.3., 9.38., 10.8. and 11.3. (See Note A-1.1.2.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Words and phrases used in Division B that are not included in the list of definitions in Article 1.4.1.2. of Division A shall have the meanings defined in the Safety Codes Act and its Regulations or the NFC(AE), or the meanings that are commonly assigned to them in the context in which they are used, taking into account the specialized use of terms by the various trades and professions to which the terminology applies.
P/T Sentence Text: Words and phrases used in Division B that are not included in the list of definitions in Article 1.4.1.2. of Division A shall have the meanings defined in the Safety Codes Act and its Regulations or the NFC(AE), or the meanings that are commonly assigned to them in the context in which they are used, taking into account the specialized use of terms by the various trades and professions to which the terminology applies.

National Sentence Text: For words not defined by Sentence 1.2.1.1.(1), reference should be made to the Oxford University Press June 2004 Canadian Oxford Dictionary, 2nd Edition
P/T Sentence Text: For words not defined by Sentence 1.2.1.1.(1), reference should be made to the Oxford University Press June 2004 Canadian Oxford Dictionary, 2nd Edition

National Sentence Text: Unless otherwise specified herein, the documents referenced in this Code shall include all amendments, revisions, reaffirmations, reapprovals, addenda and supplements effective to 01 April 2019.
P/T Sentence Text: Unless otherwise specified herein, the documents referenced in this Code shall include all amendments, revisions, reaffirmations, reapprovals, addenda and supplements effective to 01 April 2019.

National Sentence Text: A leakage-rated door assembly complying with Sentence 3.1.8.4. shall be installed in fire separations in protected floor areas referred to in Sentence Clause 3.3.1.7.(1)(b), fire separations in care or treatment occupancies referred to in Sentence 3.3.3.5.(4), and firewalls that are a horizontal exit referred to in Sentence 3.3.3.5.(3).
P/T Sentence Text: A leakage-rated door assembly complying with Sentence 3.1.8.4. shall be installed in fire separations in protected floor areas referred to in Sentence Clause 3.3.1.7.(1)(b), fire separations in care or treatment occupancies referred to in Sentence 3.3.3.5.(4), and firewalls that are a horizontal exit referred to in Sentence 3.3.3.5.(3).

National Article Title: Determination of Requirement for a Fire Alarm System
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 3.2.4.1.(2), 3.2.4.1. and 3.2.4.1.(5), a fire alarm system shall be installed in buildings in which an automatic sprinkler system is installed.
P/T Article Title: Determination of Requirement for a Fire Alarm System
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 3.2.4.1.(2), 3.2.4.1. and 3.2.4.1.(5), a fire alarm system shall be installed in buildings in which an automatic sprinkler system is installed.

National Article Title: Installation and Verification of Fire Alarm Systems
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.4.10. and 3.2.4.19., fire alarm systems, including the voice communication capability where provided, shall be installed in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S524-14 Installation of Fire Alarm Systems
P/T Article Title: Installation and Verification of Fire Alarm Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.4.10. and 3.2.4.19., fire alarm systems, including the voice communication capability where provided, shall be installed in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S524-14 Installation of Fire Alarm Systems

National Sentence Text: Where a fire alarm system is installed, visual signals shall be provided in addition to alarm signals in buildings or portions thereof intended for use primarily by persons with a hearing impairment, assembly occupancies in which music and other sounds associated with performances could exceed 100 dBA, any floor area in which the ambient noise level is more than 87 dBA, any floor area in which the occupants use ear protection devices, are located in an audiometric booth, or are located in sound-insulating enclosures, public corridors, corridors used by the public and in a floor area or part thereof where the public may congregate serving a Group A major occupancy, corridors used by the public or serving patients or residents sleeping rooms in a Group B major occupancy, washrooms, except those located within suites of residential occupancy, those located within suites of care occupancy, those located within patients sleeping rooms, and single toilet rooms, universal washrooms provided in accordance with Article 3.8.3.12., and suites of residential occupancy, such that at least one device is located within the principal living area.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a fire alarm system is installed, visual signals shall be provided in addition to alarm signals in buildings or portions thereof intended for use primarily by persons with a hearing impairment, assembly occupancies in which music and other sounds associated with performances could exceed 100 dBA, any floor area in which the ambient noise level is more than 87 dBA, any floor area in which the occupants use ear protection devices, are located in an audiometric booth, or are located in sound-insulating enclosures, public corridors, corridors used by the public and in a floor area or part thereof where the public may congregate serving a Group A major occupancy, corridors used by the public or serving patients or residents sleeping rooms in a Group B major occupancy, washrooms, except those located within suites of residential occupancy, those located within suites of care occupancy, those located within patients sleeping rooms, and single toilet rooms, universal washrooms provided in accordance with Article 3.8.3.12., and suites of residential occupancy, such that at least one device is located within the principal living area.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 3.2.5.7. to 3.2.5.7.(5), and except for a building that is neither more than 3 storeys in building height nor more than 600 m2 in building area, a building shall have water available for firefighting purposes that is provided by a piped municipal water supply capable of being delivered at a rate of not less than 3 800 L/min, and residual pressure of not less than 140 kPa, or private water supply that is not less than the quantity derived from the following formula: Q = V × O × S where Q = minimum water supply (litres), V = total building volume (cubic metres), O = water supply coefficient (from Table 3.2.5.7.), S = spatial coefficient whose value is 1.5 for a building that has any limiting distance less than 7.5 m, otherwise whose value is 1.0.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 3.2.5.7. to 3.2.5.7.(5), and except for a building that is neither more than 3 storeys in building height nor more than 600 m2 in building area, a building shall have water available for firefighting purposes that is provided by a piped municipal water supply capable of being delivered at a rate of not less than 3 800 L/min, and residual pressure of not less than 140 kPa, or private water supply that is not less than the quantity derived from the following formula: Q = V × O × S where Q = minimum water supply (litres), V = total building volume (cubic metres), O = water supply coefficient (from Table 3.2.5.7.), S = spatial coefficient whose value is 1.5 for a building that has any limiting distance less than 7.5 m, otherwise whose value is 1.0.
Comments: Insertion of Table 3.2.5.7. is not shown in this document.

National Sentence Text: The private water supply referred to in Clause 3.2.5.7.(1) shall be capable of being delivered at a rate of not less than 2 700 L/min for a building required to have a quantity less than 75 000 L, and 3 800 L/min for a building required to have a quantity of 75 000 L or greater, and provided with a dry hydrant conforming to Chapter 8 of NFPA 1142-2017 Water Supplies for Suburban and Rural Fire Fighting or pressurized hydrant conforming to the requirements of NFPA 24-2013 Installation of Private Fire Service Mains and Their Appurtenances
P/T Sentence Text: The private water supply referred to in Clause 3.2.5.7.(1) shall be capable of being delivered at a rate of not less than 2 700 L/min for a building required to have a quantity less than 75 000 L, and 3 800 L/min for a building required to have a quantity of 75 000 L or greater, and provided with a dry hydrant conforming to Chapter 8 of NFPA 1142-2017 Water Supplies for Suburban and Rural Fire Fighting or pressurized hydrant conforming to the requirements of NFPA 24-2013 Installation of Private Fire Service Mains and Their Appurtenances

National Sentence Text: Portable fire extinguishers shall be provided and installed in conformance with the NFC(AE).
P/T Sentence Text: Portable fire extinguishers shall be provided and installed in conformance with the NFC(AE).

National Sentence Text: If a fire pump is installed, it shall be installed in accordance with the requirements of NFPA 20-2016 Installation of Stationary Pumps for Fire Protection tested to ensure satisfactory operation in conformance with NFPA 20-2016 Installation of Stationary Pumps for Fire Protection and provided with emergency power meeting the requirements of Article 3.2.7.9. (See Note A-3.2.5.18.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: If a fire pump is installed, it shall be installed in accordance with the requirements of NFPA 20-2016 Installation of Stationary Pumps for Fire Protection tested to ensure satisfactory operation in conformance with NFPA 20-2016 Installation of Stationary Pumps for Fire Protection and provided with emergency power meeting the requirements of Article 3.2.7.9. (See Note A-3.2.5.18.(1).)

National Sentence Text: At least one elevator shall be provided with features described in Sentences 3.2.6.5. to 3.2.6.5.(8).
P/T Sentence Text: At least one elevator shall be provided with features described in Sentences 3.2.6.5. to 3.2.6.5.(8).
Comments: Referece to Sentences (4) to (8) changed to Sentences 3.2.6.5.(4) to 3.2.6.5.(8).

National Sentence Text: An emergency power supply capable of operating under a full load for not less than 2 h shall be provided by an emergency generator for every elevator in a building required to conform to Subsection 3.2.6., assuming that only one elevator will operate at one time, water supply for firefighting in conformance with Article 3.2.5.7., if the supply is dependent on electrical power supplied to the building, fans and other electrical equipment that are installed to maintain the air quality specified in Articles 3.2.6.2. , 3.3.3.6. and 3.3.3.7. , fans required for venting by Article 3.2.6.6., and fans required by Clause 3.2.8.4.(1) and Article 3.2.8.7. in buildings within the scope of Subsection 3.2.6. (See Note A-3.2.7.9.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: An emergency power supply capable of operating under a full load for not less than 2 h shall be provided by an emergency generator for every elevator in a building required to conform to Subsection 3.2.6., assuming that only one elevator will operate at one time, water supply for firefighting in conformance with Article 3.2.5.7., if the supply is dependent on electrical power supplied to the building, fans and other electrical equipment that are installed to maintain the air quality specified in Articles 3.2.6.2. , 3.3.3.6. and 3.3.3.7. , fans required for venting by Article 3.2.6.6., and fans required by Clause 3.2.8.4.(1) and Article 3.2.8.7. in buildings within the scope of Subsection 3.2.6. (See Note A-3.2.7.9.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Fuel supply storage for a generator prime mover shall be provided on site and shall be independent of fuel supplies for other building services.
P/T Sentence Text: Fuel supply storage for a generator prime mover shall be provided on site and shall be independent of fuel supplies for other building services.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Subsections 3.3.5. and 3.3.6., the storage, handling and use of hazardous substances shall be in conformance with the NFC(AE). (See Note A-3.3.1.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Subsections 3.3.5. and 3.3.6., the storage, handling and use of hazardous substances shall be in conformance with the NFC(AE). (See Note A-3.3.1.2.(1).)

National Sentence Text: In addition to other requirements in this Code for the installation of automatic fire extinguishing systems, an appropriate fire extinguishing system shall be installed in every industrial occupancy floor area to provide protection if required by the NFC(AE).
P/T Sentence Text: In addition to other requirements in this Code for the installation of automatic fire extinguishing systems, an appropriate fire extinguishing system shall be installed in every industrial occupancy floor area to provide protection if required by the NFC(AE).

National Sentence Text: Where wiring or electrical equipment is located in areas in which flammable gases or vapours, combustible dusts or combustible fibres are present in quantities sufficient to create a hazard, such wiring and electrical equipment shall conform to the Electrical Code Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act. (See Note A-3.3.6.2.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where wiring or electrical equipment is located in areas in which flammable gases or vapours, combustible dusts or combustible fibres are present in quantities sufficient to create a hazard, such wiring and electrical equipment shall conform to the Electrical Code Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act. (See Note A-3.3.6.2.(4).)

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Article 3.8.3.6., the minimum widths of exits shall conform to Tables 3.4.3.2.-A and 3.4.3.2.-B.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Article 3.8.3.6., the minimum widths of exits shall conform to Tables 3.4.3.2.-A and 3.4.3.2.-B.

National Sentence Text: The design, construction, installation and alteration of every elevator, escalator, passenger-elevating device, freight platform lift and dumbwaiter shall conform to the Elevating Devices Codes Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act. (See Note A-3.5.2.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: The design, construction, installation and alteration of every elevator, escalator, passenger-elevating device, freight platform lift and dumbwaiter shall conform to the Elevating Devices Codes Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act. (See Note A-3.5.2.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Before being placed in service, every elevator, escalator, passenger-elevating device, freight platform lift or dumbwaiter installation, including safety and control devices, shall be inspected and tested in accordance with the Elevating Devices Codes Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act.
P/T Sentence Text: Before being placed in service, every elevator, escalator, passenger-elevating device, freight platform lift or dumbwaiter installation, including safety and control devices, shall be inspected and tested in accordance with the Elevating Devices Codes Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act.

National Sentence Text: The installation of electrical wiring and electrical equipment shall conform to the requirements of the Electrical Code Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act.
P/T Sentence Text: The installation of electrical wiring and electrical equipment shall conform to the requirements of the Electrical Code Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act.

National Sentence Text: A lightning protection system, when provided, shall conform to the requirements of CSA CAN/CSA-B72-M87 Installation Code for Lightning Protection Systems
P/T Sentence Text: A lightning protection system, when provided, shall conform to the requirements of CSA CAN/CSA-B72-M87 Installation Code for Lightning Protection Systems

National Sentence Text: Electrical equipment that is required to be located in a service room according to the Electrical Code Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act shall be installed in a service room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Electrical equipment that is required to be located in a service room according to the Electrical Code Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act shall be installed in a service room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: An electrical equipment vault shall conform to Sentences 3.6.2.7. to 3.6.2.7. if it is required by the Electrical Code Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act.
P/T Sentence Text: An electrical equipment vault shall conform to Sentences 3.6.2.7. to 3.6.2.7. if it is required by the Electrical Code Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 3.7.2.1.(2), if the installation of a sanitary drainage system is not possible because of the absence of a water supply, sanitary privies complying with the Private Sewage Disposal Systems Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act, chemical closets or other means for the disposal of human waste shall be provided.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence , if the installation of a sanitary drainage system is not possible because of the absence of a water supply, sanitary privies, chemical closets or other means for the disposal of human waste shall be provided.

National Article Title: Areas Requiring a Barrier-Free Path of Travel
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.8.2.3.(2), a barrier-free path of travel from the entrances required by Sentences 3.8.2.2. and 3.8.2.2. to be barrier-free shall be provided throughout the entrance storey and within all other normally occupied floor areas served by a passenger elevator, escalator, inclined moving walk, or other platform-equipped passenger-elevating device. (See Article 3.3.1.7. for additional requirements regarding floor areas above or below the first storey to which a barrier-free path of travel is required.)
P/T Article Title: Areas Requiring a Barrier-Free Path of Travel
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.8.2.3.(2), 3.8.2.3. and 3.8.2.3.(5), a barrier-free path of travel from the entrances required by Sentences 3.8.2.2. and 3.8.2.2. shall be provided throughout all normally occupied floor areas. (See Article 3.3.1.7. for additional requirements regarding floor areas above or below the first storey to which a barrier-free path of travel is required.)

National Sentence Text: Glass used in shower and bathtub enclosures shall comply with Sentence 9.6.1.4.(6).
P/T Sentence Text: Glass used in shower and bathtub enclosures shall comply with Sentence 9.6.1.4.(6).

National Sentence Text: The thermal characteristics of log walls need not comply with this Section. (See Note A-9.36.2.1.(6).)
P/T Sentence Text: The thermal characteristics of log walls need not comply with this Section. (See Note A-9.36.2.1.(6).)

National Sentence Text: Wall, floor and ceiling assemblies of part 10. structures need not comply with Articles 9.36.2.3. to 9.36.2.6. (See Article 10.5.1.2.).
P/T Sentence Text: Wall, floor and ceiling assemblies of part 10. structures need not comply with Articles 9.36.2.3. to 9.36.2.6. (See Article 10.5.1.2.).

National Sentence Text: ASME/CSA ASME A17.1-2010/CSAB44-10 Safety Code for Elevators and Escalators
P/T Sentence Text: ASME/CSA ASME A17.1-2013/CSA B44-13 Safety Code for Elevators and Escalators

National Sentence Text: CSA B139-09 Installation Code for Oil-Burning Equipment
P/T Sentence Text: CSA B139-15 Installation Code for Oil-Burning Equipment

National Sentence Text: CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I
P/T Sentence Text: CSA C22.1-18 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I
